node.title: Police preparedness questioned as Parliament protest turned violent
node.description: Security experts are calling for investigations into the protests at Parliament to examine how prepared the police were for the 23-day occupation.

node.title: Enchanter skipper 'shell-shocked' after fishing charter tragedy
node.description: The skipper of the fishing charter which sank off Northland's coast is said to be in complete shock over the incident, which has claimed five lives. Audio

node.title: Commitment to improve mental health services: 'A road to nowhere'
node.description: Officials trying to revamp the country's mental health services are accused of being a "sloth at the helm of the Titanic" - but they argue it is a long-term project.

node.title: Covid-19 vaccination lessons applied in childhood immunisation programme
node.description: Health authorities are hoping to apply lessons learned during the Covid-19 vaccination rollout to boost the country's faltering childhood immunisation programme.

node.title: Best picture nominees that should have won the Oscar
node.description: Unlike "Parasite," these critically acclaimed movies were denied the highest honor in the biz. Did the Academy get it wrong?

node.title: Reporter and MLB husband help couples affected by Huntington's disease
node.description: In the U.S., there are about 41,000 people living with the disease and more than 200,000 at risk.

node.title: French energy giant Total to stop buying Russian oil
node.description: The company says it will "gradually suspend its activities in Russia" amid the worsening war in Ukraine.

node.title: Judge rules against Biden administration rules for ICE agents
node.description: The Biden administration directive instructed ICE officers to prioritize certain groups of immigrants for arrest and deportation, including those with serious criminal convictions.

node.title: Democrats circulate draft proposal that could impact Iowa's status as first nominating contest
node.description: The proposal, which was circulated Monday, says that diversity considerations will include factoring in "ethnic, geographic, union representation, economic" and other demographic components.

node.title: Tourism funding boosts Auckland businesses' confidence
node.description: Auckland businesses say a voucher scheme aimed to get locals to explore their own backyard has been a lifeline after lockdown.

node.title: White House press secretary Jen Psaki tests positive for COVID-19
node.description: Psaki said she had two "socially-distanced" meetings with President Biden on Monday and said he is not considered a close contact.

node.title: East Coast flooding: Evacuations ordered north of Gisborne, slips close highway
node.description: Severe flooding has hit the Tolaga Bay and Tokomaru Bay areas of Tairāwhiti, with some households being evacuated, and flooding and slips closed the entire East Cape highway .

node.title: Fight over spilled drink led to shooting that killed reporter, police say
node.description: Norfolk Police Chief Larry Boone​ said he is "cautiously optimistic" they will make an arrest based on where the shooting occurred.

node.title: Warehouse first half profit hit by Covid-19 restrictions
node.description: The group's stores, excluding Auckland, were closed for 23 percent of normal trading days.

node.title: Consumer confidence reaches lowest point since global financial crisis
node.description: Consumer confidence has fallen to its lowest point since the global financial crisis amid rising fuel and food prices.

node.title: The Azov Battalion: Putin's excuse for war against "Nazis" in Ukraine
node.description: References to "Nazi battalions" appear in virtually all Russian news reports about the war in Ukraine. Here's why.

node.title: 'So I get raped, he gets away with it' - Young woman horrified and revictimised during trial
node.description: You think you're doing the right thing by reporting your rape. You think it might help prevent the same thing happening to others. But what happens if your attacker is found not guilty?

node.title: Enchanter tragedy: Family remembers Waikato dad as a 'true legend'
node.description: "A true legend" is how Waikato man Mark Sanders is being described by his family, after he died in the Enchanter tragedy off North Cape. Audio

node.title: Cowboys for Trump founder convicted of entering restricted U.S. Capitol grounds
node.description: But the judge acquitted Coury Griffin of another charge of disorderly conduct.

node.title: 20 days in Mariupol: Reporters document Ukrainian city's agony
node.description: The Russians were hunting us down. They had a list of names, including ours, and they were closing in. We were the only international journalists left in the Ukrainian city of Mariupol.

node.title: Ukraine: Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta on NZ's military aid
node.description: New Zealand is providing non-lethal military aid to Ukraine in line with its current diplomatic response, and many countries were better placed to supply weapons, the Foreign Minister says.

node.title: Organisers of car meet where tanker was damaged say they couldn't control crowd
node.description: A group who helped to run a Waikato car meet, in which some of the attendees attacked a milk tanker, say they do not condone that behaviour.

node.title: Tennis great Boris Becker in court over bankruptcy charges
node.description: German tennis great Boris Becker "acted dishonestly" failing to hand over assets including his Wimbledon singles trophies before and after he was declared bankrupt, a London court has been told.

node.title: Woman, 26, charged in shoving death of 87-year-old NYC singing coach
node.description: Police said Barbara Maier Gustern's death was the result of "an unprovoked, senseless attack."

node.title: Disney in the cultural crosshairs over "Don't Say Gay" bill
node.description: Controversial measure would bar schools from instructing younger students on sexual orientation or gender identity.

node.title: Russia exploring options for cyberattacks on energy sector, FBI warns
node.description: Multiple Russia-based IP addresses have been conducting "scanning activity" for vulnerabilities in energy company networks.

node.title: Multiple tornadoes rip through homes and schools in Texas
node.description: Sozens of homes are damaged or destroyed.

node.title: Mystics too good for Steel
node.description: The Northern Mystics have beaten the Southern Steel for the first time in ANZ Premiership history with a 70-50 victory in Invercargil.

node.title: Journalist reportedly kidnapped and tortured by Russian troops in Ukraine
node.description: "Nikita has given us a chilling testimony that confirms the intensity of the war crimes perpetrated by the Russian army against journalists," the group Reporters Without Borders says.

node.title: War in Ukraine stirs painful memories for WWII survivors
node.description: CBS News reporter Michael Roppolo explores the effects of armed conflicts on children in a personal essay after interviewing his grandparents about their childhoods during WWII.
